data.name: TEXT_ADJ_APPROVE
data.value: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir continuer ? Cette étape irréversible approuvera tous les ajustements correspondant à vos critères de filtrage. Si aucun filtre n’est défini, tous les ajustements dans le système seront alors approuvés.

data.name: TEXT_ADJ_DELETE
data.value: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir continuer ? Cette étape irréversible supprimera tous les ajustements correspondant à vos critères de filtrage. Si aucun filtre n’est défini, tous les ajustements dans le système seront alors supprimés.

data.name: TEXT_ADJ_DENIED
data.value: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir continuer ? Cette étape irréversible refusera tous les ajustements correspondant à vos critères de filtrage. Si aucun filtre n’est défini, tous les ajustements dans le système seront alors refusés.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVAL_NO_CHANGES_PENDING_YOUR_APPROVAL
data.value: Aucune modification en attente à approuver

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_ACTION_APPROVE_TIP
data.value: En approuvant cette modification, vous validez son application au système

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_ACTION_RESUBMIT_TIP
data.value: Renvoyez cette modification approuvée pour tenter à nouveau de l’appliquer au système.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_ERROR_UPDATING_CHANGE_ID
data.value: Erreur de mise à jour de l’ID de modification

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_APPLIED
data.value: Cette modification a été appliquée au système. Aucune action supplémentaire n’est requise.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_APPROVEDWAITINGTOBEAPPLIED
data.value: Cette modification a été approuvée. Elle est en attente d’application au système.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_DISMISSED
data.value: Cette modification a été ignorée. Aucune action supplémentaire n’est possible.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_FAILEDTOAPPLY
data.value: Cette modification a été approuvée mais son application au système a échoué.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_PENDING
data.value: Cette modification est actuellement en attente.

data.name: TEXT_APPROVALS_STATE_EXPLANATION_SUBMITTER
data.value: En tant qu’expéditeur de cette modification en attente, vous pouvez l’ignorer pour qu’elle ne soit pas prise en compte.

data.name: TEXT_CONFIRM_DENY_NS_CONTINUE
data.value: Êtes-vous sûr de vouloir continuer ? Cette étape irréversible refusera tous les frais non standard correspondant à vos critères de filtrage. Si aucun filtre n’est défini, tous les frais non standard dans le système seront alors refusés.

data.value: Ajouter la sortie du bilan d’un solde minime

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERAL_INFO
data.value:
A Decision is used to analyze usage records (rated billing records) and possibly modify charges on the basis of this analysis. Decisions are necessary when it is impossible to determine the amount by examining a single isolated record.
For example, you may want to give a special rate if the number of telephone minutes used during the month is > 1000. You can only determine the rate to use after adding up all the usage records. If the minutes are > 1000, then for each record the rate is changed and a new charge amount is calculated. (French)

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_PARAM_TABLE
data.value: A Decision Type must be associated with a Parameter Table, which provides a way to customize key values of the Decision Type. For example, you may want the 'number of free minutes' to be editable rather than a fixed value. Before a Decision Type is configured, its associated Parameter Table must be created using the Integrated Configuration Environment (ICE).

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_ACCOUNT_GROUP
data.value:
For example, maybe one account(a parent) is billed for activity on children accounts, and you want to find the total of all charges (parent and children).

In addition to pulling other accounts in, you may want to ignore the Decision Type for some accounts. For example, you might want the Decision Type to apply only to accounts that receive paperless bills.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_CUSTOM_ACCT_GRP
data.value: For details on how you can create a new Account Group, see the documentation or contact your MetraTech representative.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_SELECT_USAGE_QUALIFICATION
data.value: By default, when working on a Decision Type for a given time span (interval- or calendar-based), AMP forms the usage by considering all the Product View records belonging to an account for that time span. You may instead want to ignore certain records. For example, maybe the Decision Type should only analyze usage of \"toll telephone call minutes\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_SUCCESS_RESORTING_GRID
data.value: Operation succeeded. The grid will be resorted.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_ITEMS_TO_AGGREGATE
data.value: (FRENCH) For example, suppose the Decision Type is \"Use a special rate if the number of minutes of usage is over 500\". The settings might include \"500\" and the \"special rate\" to apply.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD
data.value: (FRENCH) Decisions are used when a monetary charge amount cannot be calculated by looking at a single record. Instead, many usage records must be examined and a total must be the number of events, units of usage, or charge amounts. The total, or aggregate, is then used to help determine the charge amount.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD_ADD_UP_MONETARY_CHARGE
data.value: (FRENCH) Example: \"Apply a discount if there's over $100 in charges.\"

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD_ADD_UP_UNIT_OF_USAGE
data.value: (FRENCH) Example: \"Use a special rate if over 1,000 minutes.\"

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD_COUNT_NUMBER_OF_EVENTS
data.value: (FRENCH) Example: \"Apply a discount if over 100 calls were made.\"

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AGGREGATION_METHOD_FROM_PARAMETER_TABLE
data.value: (FRENCH) Usage is aggregated based on the value set in the parameter table.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DECISION_PRIORITY
data.value: (FRENCH) Suppose you have two Decisions that want to consider the same usage record and the Decisions are configured to consume the usage records. Which Decision is processed first? This is determined by the Decisions' priority levels. The lower the Numeric Priority Level, the earlier the Decision is executed. Decisions with the same priority level are executed in a nondeterministic order. On this page, you can change the priority level of the Decision Type you are configuring now.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_USAGE_OVERLAP
data.value: (FRENCH) For example, suppose you have one Decision Type that totals \"minutes\" and \"all minutes < 1000 are free\". And you have a second Decision Type that totals \"minutes\", but we only want to count minutes that were not part of the 1000. We want the second Decision Type to consider only minutes that were not consumed by the first Decision Type; therefore, the Decision Domain for both Decision Types should be set to 'Ratable'.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AMOUNT_CHAIN_GROUP
data.value: You need to select an Amount Chain Group so that the Decision Type knows what to count and how to recalculate related values. A sample Amount Chain might have four related fields in a Product View: \"the number of minutes used\", \"the rate per minute\", \"the charge amount\", and \"the tax on the charge amount\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_AMP_UI_NAME_ILLEGAL_CHAR
data.value: The name cannot contain single or double quote characters.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_HOW_APPLY
data.value:
- If the charge/credit is applied proportionally, the following fraction of the chagre/credit value is applied:
(the total - range start) / (range end - range start)
- If the charge/credit is applied inversely proportionally, the following fraction of the chagre/credit value is applied:
(range end - the total) / (range end - range start)
- If the charge/credit is applied as an aggregate multiplier, the amount of the chagre/credit is computed as:
(charge or credit value) * (aggregated value for the Decision)
where the aggregated value can be money, units of usage, or events.
- Otherwise, the entire charge/credit value is applied.

data.name: TITLE_AMPWIZARD_HELP_HOW_APPLY
data.value: Help: How should the Charge/Credit be applied?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DECISION_RANGE
data.value: For example, you are aggregating by amount and you want something special to happen every $1000.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_RANGE
data.value: For example, you may want to apply a special rate if 'total minutes are between 500 and 1000' or if 'the number of tolls is greater than 5'.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_RANGE_PRORATION
data.value:
The proration factor to apply to the range is determined by comparing a Decision Type instance's intended start and end dates with its actual start and end dates. If a Decision is intended to include 30 days of usage but in actuality only covers 15 days (e.g., the subscription starts or ends mid-period), the proration factor would be 15/30, or 0.5. If the end of range is 500 prior to proration, it becomes 250 after applying the proration factor.

Prorating on activation and termination independently allows the user control of whether each will serve to reduce the proration factor. If a Decision starts 15 days into the cycle but proration on activation is NOT chosen, those 15 days will NOT serve to reduce the proration factor.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_AMOUNT_CHAIN_GROUP_2
data.value: The Decision Settings have already described how to calculate the generated charge amount. Now you need to select the Amount Chain Group, which specifies: (a) the field in the Product View in which the generated charge amount should be stored and (b) any other fields that need to be recalculated.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_PRODUCT_VIEW
data.value: The Product View's table in the MetraNet database holds values associated with the new Charge/Credit.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_INCREMENTAL_OR_BULK
data.value: Incremental means that the Decision should take a record, add it to the total, and then if the total is within the range, perform an action. Bulk means that the Decision should total ALL the records, and then if the total falls within the range, apply the action to ALL the records.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_MULTIBUCKET
data.value: (French)Act on each individual record. Usage may have different prices which are determined by the bucket into which they fall.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_SINGLEBUCKET
data.value: (French)Act on all the records together. All usage has same price which is determined by total volume.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_UNIT_RATE
data.value:
This new rate is applied by setting the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type to the new rate multiplied by the usage. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.
Example: Once the range is met, the charge amount is 0.50 per minute.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_EVENT_RATE
data.value:
This new rate is applied by setting the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type to this new value. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.
Example: Once the range is met, \"the toll cost is $0.75\" or \"the call costs $1, regardless of the number of minutes\".

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DISCOUNT
data.value:
This discount is applied to the \"amount\" associated with the Decision Type. Any fields that are derived from \"amount\" are then recalculated.

The discount might only be applied to a portion of the amount if your Decision Type aggregates usage. For example, suppose your range start is \"500 minutes\" and the total is currently \"400 minutes\". The Decision processes a record with \"300 minutes\". \"100 minutes\" fall outside the range and \"200 minutes\" fall inside the range. If the discount is 5%, then \"amount\" is decreased by 0.05 x (200/300).

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERATED_CHARGE
data.value: Choose this option to have the Decision Type generate a new Charge or Credit. You will define the Charge/Credit on the next set of screens.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_NO_CHARGE
data.value: (French) Do not generate a charge for this decision

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_GENERATED_CHARGE_GRID
data.value: Each Generated Charge/Credit in the grid is associated with a Product View and specifies how to set the fields in the Product View and in t_acc_usage.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DECISION_CYCLE
data.value: For example, maybe the billing cycle is monthly, but you want to give a special rate if \"more than 1000 minutes are used in three months\". This is known as the Decision Cycle.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_CHARGE_CREDIT_DIRECTIVE
data.value:
There are three types of work that a directive can do as part of generating a charge or credit:
- Table Inclusion - Join to a database table or view. All fields from the selected row in the included table or view will be added as fields to the object in memory.
- Field Population - Populate a field of the object in memory by evaluating an expression or by assigning a default value.
- Procedure Execution - Execute an MVM procedure. This provides a mechanism for doing anything that cannot be accomplished through table inclusion and field population.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DIRECTIVES
data.value: This table shows what fields in the product view and t_acc_usage have Field Population directives defined for them. It's designed to help you see what fields still need to be set.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_MORE_DIRECTIVES
data.value: Description of different types of steps: database table inclusion, field population, procedure execution

data.name: TITLE_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DIRECTIVES
data.value: Help: Product View and t_acc_usage fields

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_USAGE_QUALIFICATION
data.value: You can even create Usage Qualifications that reference other previously defined Usage Qualifications. For example, you may want the usage record to also meet other previously defined conditions.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_FILTER
data.value:
In the filter, you can check for specific values of product view fields and t_acc_usage fields, or you can check if other Usage Qualifications (that you've already built) are satisfied. You can use parentheses and the keywords \"and\", \"or\", \"==\", \"!=\", and \"!\". Use the Insert buttons to insert snippets of the filter at the cursor.

In the filter, \"OBJECT\" refers to the usage record and \"GROUP\" refers to another usage qualification group.

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_DELETE_DIRECTIVE_CONFIRM
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this directive?

data.name: TEXT_DELETE_BS_EXEMPTION
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this BillSoft Exemption?

data.name: TEXT_DELETE_BS_OVERRIDE
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this BillSoft Override?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_DELETE_ACCOUNT_QUALIFICATION_CONFIRM
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this Account Qualification?

data.name: TEXT_AMPWIZARD_HELP_DIRECTIVE_FILTER
data.value: The Condition for Execution is a freeform MVM expression that is evaluated when the directive is about to be executed. If the expression evaluates to 1, execution of the directive goes forth; if it evaluates to something other than 1, the directive is NOT executed. This field applies to Table Inclusion, Field Population, and Procedure Execution.

data.name: ERROR_BILL_MESSAGE_DATES
data.value: Error: End Date needs to be later than Start Date
